## Data Camp

Please go through and complete the following module

```{r eval = TRUE, echo = FALSE, message=FALSE}
unchecked <- as.character(fontawesome::fa("square", fill = "steelblue"))

checked <- as.character(fontawesome::fa("square-check", fill = "steelblue"))

dcico <- as.character("/logos/dc-ico.png{width=20px}")

dc_schedule <-  
  read_csv(here::here("content", "dc.csv"),
           show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
  as_tibble() %>%
  mutate(across(everything(), ~ case_when(
    . == "checked" ~ as.character(fontawesome::fa("circle-check", fill = "#428bca", height = "15px")),
    . == "unchecked" ~ as.character(fontawesome::fa("circle-xmark", fill = "#d9534f", height = "15px")),
    TRUE ~ as.character(.)
              ))) %>%
  filter(Week == "2") %>% #CHANGE HERE
  select(-Week) %>%
  mutate(across(everything(), as.character)) %>%
  mutate(across(everything(), str_squish)) %>%
  rename(`Due by` = Due) %>%
#  filter_all(any_vars(!is.na(.))) %>% 
  mutate(
    across(everything(), ~replace_na(.x, ""))
    ) %>%
  select_if(~!all(is.na(.))) %>%
  mutate(Link = str_replace_all(Link, "hyper",
                                paste0("[![",dcico,"](/logos/dc-ico.png 'Slack Icon'){width=20px}]",
                           "(https://www.datacamp.com/){target='_blank'}"
  ))) %>%
  select(-Link)
  
```

## R Task

Please follow the directions listed below

1. Download the task files

<center>
```{r echo=FALSE,eval=TRUE,message=FALSE}
loc <- here::here("static", "rtasks", "IntroductionToTheTidyverse.zip")

downloadthis::download_file(
  path = loc,
  output_name = "Introduction to the Tidyverse Task",
  button_label = "&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<span style='color:#ffffff'>Download</span>",
  button_type = "primary",
  has_icon = TRUE,
  icon = "fa fa-save",
  class = "hvr-sweep-to-left"
  )
```
</center>
<br>

2. [Unzip](/resources/unzipping) them on your computer

3. Open the file `Introduction to the Tidyverse walkthrough.Rmd`, click on Run Document, and then go through the walkthrough preferably in a larger window. To see how to do this, open the file `Introduction to the Tidyverse loading.gif` in the web browser of your choice or by another method to view the animated gif

4. After finishing the walkthrough, open the mostly empty script to `Introduction to the Tidyverse script.R` and load up the `tidyverse` library. *Please be aware that it is included for you in this first task but will not be in the future*

5. Keeping the hashtag, erase the words at the top and replace them with your full name

6. Load the `diamonds`^[Comes from the `ggplot2` package which is also in `tidyverse`] data set in the same way as `starwars` was shown in the walkthrough. Then recode the following values in the `cut` column in a new column named `cut_recoded`

    - **Ideal** with **5**
    - **Premium** with **4**
    - **Very Good** with **3**
    - **Good** with **2**
    - **Fair** with **1**
    
    and everything else with **0**. Your output should consist of two columns - the unique original values and their respective recoding.

7. Save the file by adding your first initial and last name to the beginning of the filename. For example, my submission would be `aroy Introduction to the Tidyverse script.R`

8. Submit the script to [eCampus](https://ecampus.wvu.edu) in the Submission Portal.
